Sequence Information.Peptide Name: mCRAMP-2 (mouse cathelin-related antimicrobial peptide 2; cathelicidin; Rodents, mammals, animals
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=1 µM), Escherichia coli ML35 (MIC=2 µM), Escherichia coli D21 (MIC=8 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC=4 µM), Serratia marcescens ATCC 8100 (MIC=4 µM);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC=32 µM), Staphylococcus aureus Cowan I (MIC=32 µM), Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) (MIC>64 µM), Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) (MIC=64 µM), Staphylococcus epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC=16 µM), Streptococcus faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC=32 µM), Bacillus megaterium Bm11 (MIC=4 µM).Fungi:Candida albicans (MIC>64 µM), Cryptococcus neoformans (MIC=16 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The CD spectra of CRAMP-2 (not shown) were similar to CRAMP-1.
Sequence Information.Function: Acts as a potent antimicrobial peptide.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed in testis, spleen, stomach, and intestine. Very low expression found in heart, lung and skeletal muscle. No expression in brain, kidney or liver.

Literature.Title: Identification of CRAMP, a cathelin-related antimicrobial peptide expressed in the embryonic and adult mouse.
Literature.Author: Gallo RL, Kim KJ, Bernfield M, Kozak CA, Zanetti M, Merluzzi L, Gennaro R.

Literature.Title: A novel murine cathelin-like protein expressed in bone marrow.
Literature.Author: Popsueva AE, Zinovjeva MV, Visser JW, Zijlmans JM, Fibbe WE, Belyavsky AV.

Literature.Title: The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
